snippet: This one-man show revolves around a man who has apparently simply dialed a wrong number and then stays on the line to talk. And talk....
abstract: Ben Brantley reviews Daniel Kitson one-man play Mouse: The Persistence of an Unlikely Thought, at St Ann's Warehouse.
lead_paragraph: This one-man show revolves around a man who has apparently simply dialed a wrong number and then stays on the line to talk. And talk.

headline.main: Review: Daniel Kitson’s ‘Mouse’ Tells Its Tales Over a Speakerphone
headline.print_headline: Sorry, Wrong Number, but Hey, Let’s Have a Talk

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Mouse: The Persistence of an Unlikely Thought (Play)
